fields.caption:
**Ask the Editors**

 Want to get in touch with a specific member of the Teen Vogue team? [Email us!](http://www.teenvogue.com/contact/tellus)



**Modeling Policy**

 Teen Vogue works with established modeling agencies to cast talent in our editorials. We do NOT recruit models via TeenVogue.com, Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, email, or anywhere online. Please see our [model policy](http://www.teenvogue.com/magazine/2011/model-policy) and [send us an email](http://www.teenvogue.com/contact/tellus) if you’ve been contacted by a representative claiming they are from Teen Vogue.



**Subscription Questions**

 If you have questions about your subscription, check out our [customer care](https://w1.buysub.com/pubs/N3/TNV/login_3_methods.jsp?cds_page_id=10531&cds_mag_code=TNV&id=1344392260198&lsid=22202117150023600&vid=2) page or e-mail [TNVcustserv@cdsfulfillment.com](mailto:TNVcustserv@cdsfulfillment.com).



**Email the Webmaster**

 Having a technical problem with the site? Link down? [Let us know about it](http://www.teenvogue.com/contact/contact_tnv)! If you’re wondering about advertising or anything else, [send in a V-Mail](http://www.teenvogue.com/contact/tellus).



**Press Inquiries**

 Contact our Senior Public Relations Director [Erin Kaplan](mailto:Erin_Kaplan@condenast.com).



**Sweepstakes Inquiries**

 Interested in learning more about our Win It section? [Email us](mailto:sweepstakes@teenvogue.com)!

photosTout.title: **Have Questions for the _Teen Vogue_ Team?**

items.hed: These 8 Apps Will Make You The Most Efficient Student Ever
items.body:
Now that it’s September and back-to-school season is really in full swing (as in, in a classroom, right now) we’re turning our attention not only to the super fun beginning of the school year stuff but also, you know, that whole *learning* thing. Since we’re all basically attached to our phones and other devices, we wanted to know how to make the most of them for class, homework, and anything else academic that comes our way. Luckily, [Lifehack](http://www.lifehack.org/304224/8-useful-apps-every-learner-should-not-miss) rounded up eight of the best apps to (down)load up on before the bell rings.  

__1.__ [Evernote](https://evernote.com/)
Your very best note-taking companion, Evernote is especially helpful because you can sync it with every last one of your devices. You can also use it to collect articles, recipes, and links from online and the app will even create presentations straight from your notes.

__2.__ [Scrivener](https://www.literatureandlatte.com/scrivener.php)
Working on a super long paper or research project? Scrivener is your new best friend. You can see side-by-side drafts for comparison, use the virtual corkboard to layout your outline, and even switch into scriptwriting mode (for all you film students out there).


__3.__ [Wikipanion](https://itunes.apple.com/us/app/wikipanion/id288349436?mt=8)
Look, we all know that Wikipedia is not a source to use for research papers. But, sometimes you just gotta know some facts — and the best articles provide citations that you actually *can* use. So use Wikipanion to make Wikipedia even more easily searchable from your devices.


__4.__ [Mailbox](https://blogs.dropbox.com/mailbox/)
Let's be real: we're all on a million and one email lists and there's no sign of that number decreasing. Luckily Mailbox will help you streamline your inbox with just a few swipes and taps of a finger. You can arrange mail into to-do lists and even put them emails on hold until they're actually relevant. Inbox zero, here you come.

__5.__ [LastPass](https://lastpass.com/)
Never forget a password again.

__6.__ [Pocket](https://getpocket.com/)
Never have enough time to read everything you want online? Save links and articles for later with Pocket — you can even read them when you're not connected to the internet, aka perfect for your commute home.

__7.__ [Drafts](http://agiletortoise.com/drafts/) 
For those of us that love a clean sheet of paper, Drafts is the digital equivalent. You can just open it up and start writing each time, no need to open a new document. Plus, it utilizes the all-important auto-save, so each precious thought stays right where it should be.
 
__8.__ [Lynda](http://www.lynda.com/)
This one might be a little pricey ($30/month) but trust us when we say it’s money well-spent. The site offers video tutorials on just about anything — including things like Photoshop, web design, and HTML. So if you’ve been wanting to learn to code, but there’s not a class that fits into your busy schedule, sign up for Lynda and learn on your own! 

__Related:__ [10 iPhone Tricks That'll Make Heading Back to School Infinitely Easier](http://www.teenvogue.com/story/apple-iphone-tips-tricks-back-to-school)

items.socialTitle: These 8 Apps Will Make You The Most Efficient Student Ever
